website_summaries.verdict: A tough, highly customizable mouse with practical and nice-looking visual features, this will satisfy all but the most hard-core gamers.
pros: Very durable, withstanding drops from desk height with no problem
Visual DPI indicators are a huge help
Button presets are easy to program and perfect for games like Minecraft
cons: Configuration software is confusing to use
Mouse buttons and number pad can fail after a year or so of constant use

customer_reviews.title: Awful
customer_reviews.text: Side buttons are awful, terribly shaped, very awkward to use, and do not click well when pushed, half of them seemed word out, sometimes you can't even tell if you've pushed the button or not. Mouse feels very strange in the hand compared to other mice, material is coarse and uncomfortable. Requested a refund 10 minutes after opening the package. EXTREMELY displeased. Would rather use my broken Naga then this, so that,s saying something. 0/10 do NOT buy.
customer_reviews.author: Francis

customer_reviews.title: Most dependable mouse I've had
customer_reviews.text: My parents got me this mouse years ago for Christmas and it was my first 'real' gaming mouse. I used it for years on many MMOs, but for some dumb reason decided to 'upgrade' to a name brand mouse. The new mouse was awful and constantly stuttered no matter what I did with my settings or what mouse pad I used. I finally went back to this old trusty mouse and have had no issues. I don't know why I ever switched, this mouse has everything you could need and is very easy to customize in the Utech app. I'll never switch my mouse again.
customer_reviews.author: Starr

customer_reviews.title: It'd be 5 stars if not for the 'lip'
customer_reviews.text: I love the mouse, it's great to use - but there's a small problem. Under the numbers is a small lip of plastic where your thumb can rest - except it's not wide enough. It's very thin, and when playing for any length of time, I wind up with a sore thumb from the edge pressing into my skin. I was able to fix this with some Sugru. Docking them a star because if they extended the lip into a proper thumb rest, it wouldn't be a problem. Other than that, it has a good feel, it's customizable, the buttons have good sensory input so you can touch-type with them.
customer_reviews.author: Spookyevilone

customer_reviews.title: Feels terrible, heavy pressure required.
customer_reviews.text: The overall quality of the mouse feels terrible, and badly designed. You have to move your hand a lot to reach all buttons, and they made the entire mouse TEXTURED so it rubs your hand any time you move. The buttons on the side are the worst to try and press out of ANY mmo mouse I have ever tried. I wish I had tried to use it earlier to return it because it's a WASTE of money.
customer_reviews.author: Wolf

customer_reviews.title: good mouse, terrible software
customer_reviews.text: so i get the mouse, it works pretty good. download all the updated drivers. attempt to customize the settings in the on board menu only to have the program refruses to apply the settings. the program keeps telling me to connect the device i want to apply the settings to, even though im using said device without issues. ive reboot my comp, updated drivers several times, deleted and redownloaded with no avail. the mouse works fine with its initial factory settings, but the programs to customize it are JUNK. ill buy another mouse to use for gaming i guess and use this one as a back up. oh well...
customer_reviews.author: jesse t. houdlette

customer_reviews.title: Utech Venus
customer_reviews.text: Gift for my grandson. Did a lot of research for gaming mice before purchase. I helped set up the mouse and install software. For the price, it seems to be a high quality built mouse. Time will tell as my grandson puts it to the test. Got it for participation in MMO games. I would have like to have more information in the manual on how to set up the buttons. although it doesn't seem difficult, it is different than the usual setup and more instruction would have been helpful. So far, very satisfied with the performance.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Software doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I had (I guess an older version of) this mouse in the past; It broke. It's a great mouse but the software required for this new version does not work. The same mouse. Same software (lookswise). Doesn't work. If you're looking for a mouse with LMB,RMB,MMB, DPI up/Down, and Triple click, go for it. But don't plan on CHANGING any of the keybinds. The software freezes up the PC and even if you manage to let it load long enough to apply a change, it will not actually apply your change or it will tell you to please connect the mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Freeman

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: This is a much more affordable version of some way more expensive gaming mouses (mice?). Sensitivity control easily accessible on top with visual indicator of the setting, smooth buttons, many buttons to bind controls to within comfortable reach. Buttons are in angled rows on the side so you can determine what you are pressing without looking. You can easily change the color of the lights to match your set-up. The cord seems to be good quality and is very long. I'm very happy with this purchase. I've had it since November 2019 and it has met my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Kelli

customer_reviews.title: Love It
customer_reviews.text: So happy with this mouse! I only really play warcraft, and have gotten used to the extra buttons. My razor naga finally gave up the ghost, I had the original version which wasn't as ergonomically designed as the newer version. I have to say I very much prefer this mouse over the naga. The weight, button design (the angle makes them much more tactile than the naga, easier to find), and texture all feel superior to me. My only complaint is the single button next to the left mouse button where the naga had two. If I can figure out how to program it as the browser back button I'll be in hog heaven.
customer_reviews.author: Taupe

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: The shell feels cheap and overall a little too big for my hand which is the size of an average American womans. The side buttons are angled so you know if you are on 1-6 or 7-12. the downside is that there is no gap between rows making hitting the wrong button easier than other designs. The DPI button is in the middle behind the wheel and I find that I hit the down button often. The software is fine. I cannot compare the RGB component but it was fairly easy to configure. I have been using a competitor's side button mouse for over 7 years and only replacing it because left click got too clicky.
customer_reviews.author: Angry Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Water resistant?
customer_reviews.text: Okay so for around 2 plus years this mouse has been used weekly and sometimes daily for playing hardcore fps shooters and starcraft etc etc... but today this mouse has exceeded my expectations by the extreme...I was cleaning some lava rocks for my aquarium and some how managed to drop this mouse this into the bucket... it was fully submerged for around a minute whole plugged in to my computer. I assumed all was lost but to my surprise it was still working fine... so I hit it was hair dryer and it's working as nothing has happened. Was gonna buy a new one but it still works just fine. JUST FINE
customer_reviews.author: manny

customer_reviews.title: I love it but I've had to buy several of them.
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent and easily programmable mouse. I absolutely love it. But the quality control isn't great. I'm on my 4th. I've had 1 arrive dead and 2 become useless because of the cables. They come with an absolutely huge USB connector that does not conform to many spaces. It plugs in fine but sticks out so far that the cable ends up getting bent and in my case, eventually breaking. That said I still replace it with the same model because at this price, 18 buttons with a truly easy key mapping is hard to find. It even comes with adjustable weights.
customer_reviews.author: Raum

customer_reviews.title: Good mouse for engineering.
customer_reviews.text: Great Mouse - I like the precision and settings. I purchased the mouse with a new Dell G7 Laptop for engineering. I needed something with precision for AutoCad and with programmable buttons. So far I've had no issues with the software and appreciate the design that went into the mouse for the weight/feel and overall functions. I'm not one into too much fluff for work stuff, but I did change the light pattern and they even did a great attention to detail with that. As far as gaming - can't tell you. For work - its what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: P. Green

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars! A great mouse!
customer_reviews.text: The mouse is very nice to hold and is visually appealing. The 12 programmable side buttons are very useful for talking with friends and casual gaming. The amount of customization was surprising and is a very nice feature. Almost everything that was part of the mouse or that came with the mouse felt premium and long lasting. The only thing that I personally think needed improvement was the packaging. I personally believe the packaging felt unprofessional and not very well put together. Nonetheless, the overall product was good and was exactly what was advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Tami

customer_reviews.title: Best budget gaming mouse, bar none.
customer_reviews.text: Second mouse I buy from this brand, the first one is the older model which still works perfectly after around 8-9 years of continuous use. I bought this one as a "treat" and I'm happy I did. The ergonomics are fantastic, it has a nudge for your ring-finger which is just magnificent, whoever thought of it is a genius. The mouse comes with several weight pieces so you can adjust it to your liking; I love a heavy mouse because I crank up the sensitivity and DPI, that way I barely have to move my hand. This relatively unknown brand is top-notch.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Pineda Arauz

customer_reviews.title: Replaced my Logitech G502 with this
customer_reviews.text: Over time my logitech mouse continually frustrated me during gaming due to being either too sensitive or not sensitive enough with button clicks, mouse wheel turns or simply having the mouse wheel accidentally click loose while playing. Also it was way too easy to accidentally change the DPI while playing. This in the few hours I have spent already has WAY more programming capabilities, much tighter movement, all the buttons feel nice to the touch with the right amount of resistance to them. All for half the price! Definitely happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff H

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: Discalmer: I was sent a free mouse. The mouse is pretty nice. I have a purple themed computer and this mouse fits perfectly, besides the dpi LED being lit up red no matter what. I would recommend this mouse certainly. The keypads on the side are intelligently curved for the type of reaches you would do for your thumb. I will say, I do wish I had an extra button for my middle finger like my index finger has, but all well. Drivers do exist for this product. The interface looks pretty low effort, but it gets the job done. The driver is actually more consistent than my k55 keyboard driver. Go figure.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Great versatility for a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: Mouse is well made, the bundled software is simple and to the point, yet allows for countless variations for button programming, from Combo commands to the Included macro maker software. Pretty, durable, could have slightly more weight, but overall very happy with purchase. Makes Max Payne 3 and other fps games which might require a few extra key binds a breeze!! Also great for RTS games, you can make groups using the control (x) function, and then select the group using the appropriate number from the side pad. Exactly what I have always wished for in a gaming mouse, without the 100$ price tag. 5/5
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Fitt

customer_reviews.title: Great gaming mouse / Replacement with warranty
customer_reviews.text: The sensor is really precise, it doesn't overreach at all so it's simple to turn in video games without having to pick up the mouse a whole lot. The precision is really good, I'm less likely to over-correct or under-correct in my gaming sessions. I've been doing very well using this mouse playing games and it also made other single-player games simpler to play as well. It has a very good balance between DPI, IPS, and sensitivity. Also, it looks pretty awesome; The design is really cool and I like the breathing LED lights that change colors. ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Update: After 3 months usage, the mouse suddenly died. I got a replacement for 18-month warranty. I think this is cool!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Quinn

customer_reviews.title: Great Mouse for a Good Price
customer_reviews.text: I really love this mouse, and have replaced my other with it. I love that you have so many customization options, from the light colors to the DPI and polling rate. There are multiple profiles which allows you to save different settings based on your play style. The mouse works well, and while I didn't think I would, I actually love having so many buttons to program. I also feel like the mouse "points" more accurately than my older mouse. Overally, this is a great mouse for a good price. I did receive this mouse to test and review, and I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Larsen

customer_reviews.title: Solid mouse, especially for the price
customer_reviews.text: At the price point, this is an amazingly solid mouse. It FEELS good. The grip surfaces are very slightly rough so it doesn't get slippery, the buttons feel well made, and the side buttons are nicely positioned (though the 10 - 12 buttons are a bit far back for my massive paws). It feels like a much more expensive mouse than it is, and it fits very comfortably for users with larger hands (I can palm a basketball). Overall, a great product. My wife has been using the same mouse for a couple of years now and recommended it to me when my old Logitech died. I've used hers on many occasions and have to say, great product.
customer_reviews.author: Brandy Irie

customer_reviews.title: 4 year review
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Venus in December of 2014. Pros: Everything is perfect with this mouse including button functions and customization. While it worked it was a pleasure to use and game with. Cons: After 4 years of usage the mouse is starting to fail: - random USB disconnects and reconnects - changed USB ports and reinstalled drivers but problem persists - Y-Axis upward movement is now partially broken. When moving mouse up slowly, the sensor has trouble sensing the movements, with cursor hesitating to move which makes it difficult to zero in on small icons, links, etc. Verdict, I got 4 years out of it so I'll buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: Rafal G

customer_reviews.title: Competitive High Precision Gaming Mouse
customer_reviews.text: I was in the market for a new right handed gaming mouse. I decided to try UtechSmart's Venus Gaming Mouse w/ High Precision. Item was delivered by Prime which is a plus in its own right. Mouse was functional by plug-n-play without any driver issue. Running on Windows 10 Pro - Version 1903. Installed UtechSmart's software for full customization and precision with no issue. Everything is easily customizable - point and click - even RGB lighting. Quick button on top of mouse is great for instant increase or decrease mouse precisioning. Mouse comes with 8 weighted bits (pre-installed underneath mouse) -- remove as one sees fit. USB mouse cable is braided for high quality and durability.
customer_reviews.author: cody989

customer_reviews.title: Broken mouse design. dont buy
customer_reviews.text: I have bought 2 of these mouses now and no luck on it working properly......and do not expect and exchange or return or refund. The mouse wheel click doesn't work well...the fist on lasted 3 months or less and this 2nd on lasted around the same. it's horrible and unable to use. it's like it was built broken. I would recommend a different mouse with a more proper mouse click function or one that isn't built broken and mailed to customers. * first review How can you have a product being sold and the website is not secure. Put some effort time and money into completing your security for yourselves and for the comfort and safety of your customers.
customer_reviews.author: Brant

customer_reviews.title: Offensive to the touch.  UPDATED Review
customer_reviews.text: I'm fairly sensitive to certain textures and this one is just awful. It feels like a mouse wrapped in construction paper. Side buttons also do not seem to work for combo settings..... Like Shift + W does not function. I may have received a malfunctioning unit. UPDATE: This company knows how to treat it's customers... They reached out to me and offered to send me a new mouse. I received the Vacuum plated version and this one is the bee's knees. Feels wonderful... I strongly recommend getting that version if you have any aversion to a textured mouse. Top notch customer service. :)
customer_reviews.author: M. Paulsen

customer_reviews.title: Not working for me.
customer_reviews.text: So far my mouse pointer is shaky does not run in a straight line on the screen. The mouse wheel has started creaking for some reason which is annoying. At one point the buttons that change the dpi got stuck in the mouse and I had to pull it up with a tiny flathead. Basically having nothing but problems at the moment with this mouse. Talked to support and they were really helpful and are sending me out a new one so if this next one is bad they said they will offer me a refund will give good review just for the customer service support was superb and they seem to really care about their customers.
customer_reviews.author: Kinasin

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic gaming mouse
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this for about a month and so far am enjoying this product. It comes with instructions, a little weights to customize the feel of the mouse while using it. I use about half the weights right now. The software is easy to use, and very straightforward. The tilted number pads help identify which numbers I am using while gaming, making its overall feel very intuitive. It is bigger than my last mouse, but easy to adjust to. I do have smaller hands, so reaching the 10, 11, and 12 numbers on the side number pad can be tricky.
customer_reviews.author: Stevie

customer_reviews.title: Version 1 vs 2 sofware
customer_reviews.text: I own one of these, and then bought another one as a gift. The mouse looks the same, but the one I own is software Version 1, the one I bought here is Version 2. (The version you download depends on the mouse you get, ). Version 1 allows much more macro actions (almost twice as much) as the Version 2. It works and all, I'm just annoyed by the limited actions of Version 2 (~32 actions) vs Version 1 (~64 actions). Nothing was mentioned in the description about the 2 versions.
customer_reviews.author: NTN

customer_reviews.title: 1.5 years and still going strong
customer_reviews.text: This mouse is phenomenal for the price. The software is fairly easy to use and the mouse is very durable. I bought it a year and a half ago and it is still like new. The only real gripe I have with it is the side buttons are very close together so while gaming, it can be difficult to access the 7-12 keys. However, I usually don't macro that many things so it is not a huge issue. Also the pads on the bottom have worn out a little, but that is expected over time and the mouse does come with a second set of them. Outstanding purchase and glad I went with this mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Good mouse for regular and gaming use.
customer_reviews.text: This mouse out did my last mouse which you had to click on the very corners of the clickers otherwise you would end up getting double/triple clicks. You can easily get the driver from the manufacturer's website and customize the extra button on the left and change the light color. I would recommend this mouse if you're looking for both a cheap option and a good quality mouse. Edit: The side buttons are registered as numbers 1-9 instead of being registered as a different unit which might prove annoying when setting them up for games.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse for a good price.
customer_reviews.text: Good price for a quality mouse. It's not the Razer Naga, but it does not feel like a cheap imitation, I have used this mouse for two months know for gaming in MMO's, general use, and even some precision work in Photoshop. The buttons are easy to navigate, and it is easy to get used to, though a little awkward at first if you are not used to reaching the 10, 11, 12 keys near the heel of your hand. Go through a couple of dungeons in an MMO, focusing some of your main attacks on the rear three buttons with this and you will get used to it quick. Quality mouse and you can't complain about the price!
customer_reviews.author: Frank Armand

customer_reviews.title: Amazing mouse
customer_reviews.text: Wow. I bought this for Adobe editing (Photoshop, illustrator, premiere pro, etc) and FPS gaming. Wow. The program software (included on disc, don't bother with website) is fantastic, and has many different profiles. This is great for keying Photoshop and illustrator to the side number pad, while maintaining different settings for various video games. Very quick to change and can set color indicators with mouse LED to visually verify current profile setting (ie, blue for Photoshop, yellow for Illustrator, red for FPS games, etc). Make sure you get a good mouse pad too. The Venus combined with a Corsair Gaming mouse pad (($10) made this mouse surgically precise.
customer_reviews.author: R.

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse turns horrible after windows update. and now im pissed
customer_reviews.text: After about a year of using this mouse and enjoying it to the max. I am pissed that suddenly the mouse malfunctions by constantly double-clicking. It happens nearly 40% of the time now and Its driving me nuts! this started happening about 3 weeks ago after a windows update. I really dont wanna be spending more money on the mouse. I have tried a bunch of times to re-install the driver and still the problem continues! Update: I should note that my previous Utech mouse did the same thing, except it was with the middle click, also after about a year of use.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: Automatically set up and working within seconds
customer_reviews.text: I'm assuming those saying it doesn't work or it couldn't be set up are coming from those with very old operating systems. I have Windows 10 and the setup was complete automatically within seconds, just by plugging it in. All of the features of this mouse including the numpad work. I didn't have to go anywhere and download anything, as some of these reviews stated. The mouse is pretty quiet, though not dead silent. It is much more quiet than most similar gaming mouses, I have owned a few. I like the added functionality of this mouse. A comparable mouse sold in the store would cost far more.
customer_reviews.author: Scott H.

customer_reviews.title: this is a legit mouse.....i like it!!!
customer_reviews.text: works straight out the box, installation software included, and you can download updates from their website. installation of the software was fast and easy, and the "app" for the mouse is nice and easy, with lots of features. the light can be changed to many different colors and you can change the brightness and breathing settings. very cool mouse, best one ive ever owned so far. dont know how well it would work using the buttons on the side for games, because they are so close together.
customer_reviews.author: SAMFISHER

customer_reviews.title: Quality Bargain Buy
customer_reviews.text: This mouse works great for a much cheaper price than the two high priced major brand "gaming mice" I purchased that stopped working. This mouse has lasted for several year now and performs great. The programmable buttons worked great for my computer gaming, it's smooth and responsive. I recently purchased another to use when I work with my Apple MacBook. The size and design allow my hand to rest on the mouse comfortably for long stretches. I'm really happy with my purchase. I don't plan on ever buying any other kind.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Favorite mouse
customer_reviews.text: It's been over a year and this is still my favorite mouse. Weight, quality, button clicks, scroll wheel, dpi, long cord, ergonomic - this mouse is great in all these aspects. The only reason I have shopped for a different mouse recently is because of wrist strain (not specific to this mouse, just all normal mice in general) which I'm hoping will be eased by a vertical mouse. I don't want to stop using my Utech but I may have to occasionally.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Reinard

customer_reviews.title: Goodbye Logitech
customer_reviews.text: The programability of this mouse, from keys to key combos to macros to any other windows commands is outstanding. With Logitech mice, I am sick of the single-click buttons becoming defective and double-clicking. I'm also tired of not being able to put a double-click on the standard right-click button for most of their mice. One downside, initially at least, is that the side buttons require too much leverage to push and its hard to keep the mouse stable clicking them.
customer_reviews.author: wb

customer_reviews.title: Great Side Button Mouse!
customer_reviews.text: I Really like this mouse! Coming from Several different side button mice over the years this one is a 10...great responsiveness and very nice feel....for me personally a little difficult as I have small hands and the side profile is taller than what I am used to. However I am adjusting and you can't go wrong with this mouse for the money. Have been using it daily now for almost 2 weeks and other than height can't find any issues with it. Really Awesome that I can replace my expensive not long lived mouse with one equal to or better! Thank You!
customer_reviews.author: Tapdancer

customer_reviews.title: Worst mouse ive probably ever used
customer_reviews.text: And its not because its a bad mouse. Its the feel of the mouse. They encased in this gritty grip to help with grit and all it does is make your hands sweaty and feels uncomfortable. It itself is not a bad mouse the buttons worked everything worked fine but the feel of the mouse is utterly to much. With nowhere to rest my pinky I was constantly scrunching it against the side which was also uncomfortable. Basically, its a good mouse just don't expect any level of comfort at all. Switch to rubber grips for your products guys. Grit is not meant to be held onto like that.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Hawkins

customer_reviews.title: Most functional Gaming mouse
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after five weeks. Was causing my computer to have power surge issues on my USB ports. Absolutely stay away from this one. **UPDATE** Company reached out to me and immediately sent a new mouse. This one works perfectly! I'm assuming the first just had a fluke issue that any manufactured electronic could have. The button layout and features of this mouse are the best I've found for gaming so I'm glad the company helped me get back on track with a new mouse.
customer_reviews.author: guardeiro

customer_reviews.title: DOA
customer_reviews.text: Laser was not operational and some of the lights were out straight from the box. I had high hopes due to the good reviews, but it was not meant to be. After receiving it in this condition, web search showed that this wasn't an isolated incident. Stick with name brands you actually recognize..... **Update - the seller followed up immediately after I returned the defective mouse and replaced it free of charge. Amazing customer support that went above and beyond what was expected. Also, the replacement mouse works amazing. Thank you so much UTECHSMART and especially Mary Jean. A+++++++ seller.
customer_reviews.author: Andreas J. Munsey

customer_reviews.title: Good Mouse, Tricky Interface
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mouse because my outdated Razer Naga Hex was starting to act up. I also have tendonitis and carpal tunnel in my right hand/arm. This mouse has really helped relieve some of the stress from those conditions and made it much more comfortable to play for extended period of time. I generally play for 3-8 hours at a time and never have any issues with pain. The reason my review is only 4 stars is because the settings interface is really complicated. Once you figure it out it's pretty easy, but it takes a while. Overall a really great gaming mouse and I would definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Not working properly
customer_reviews.text: Had no issue installing and getting it to work, simple and easy and LOVE the mouse and the software works right out of the box. After some time using it I notice that suddenly the mouse has a life of it's own. If you right click it acts like another button. I had it open other tabs in my browser, act as a back button even when I do nothing to the buttons. It is not worth the money if the mouse does whatever it feels like and NOT what you need it to.
customer_reviews.author: Jason M.

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I'll be using this mouse for gaming and for regular computer use. I just got it, plugged it in, installed the included software and was tweaked the setting as I liked and was good to go less than a minute later. The mouse has a nice feel and it is not shiny so your hand won't slip. Has a nice thumb rest and the included weights were already in the mouse; it also comes with a nice little container if you don't want the weights or if you want to remove some weight. Another plus, in my book, it came with extra pads for the bottom of the mouse.
customer_reviews.author: H. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price. [30ish]
customer_reviews.text: In comparison to the Madcatz MMO.TE, this mouse feels slightly better. I just got the mouse and the build quality is very nice. The texture is an almost extremely fine sand paper feel, which is honestly very nice. It's large enough to fit my average male sized hand, but not too big. The programming interface is OK. Nothing crazy in depth, but you can do some macros and have different profiles that are pretty easy to switch between. I'm not a huge fan of the side button layout, as compared to my old mouse... but it might just take some getting used to. In general it's well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: It's C.

customer_reviews.title: Worked for 5 months
customer_reviews.text: Update: Someone from Utech contacted me directly and replaced my mouse since mine was not working. Great customer service and Utechseems to care about their customer base. I will say if you have small hands this is a pretty fat mouse and it takes some getting used to I replaced a Naga whose cord kept going bad with this mouse. It worked for about 5 months however now my mouse is keeps shorting out and I have to disconnect and reconnect multiple times mid game. So I guess I’m in market for yet another...
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: it came in the mail a few weeks ago and it’s surprisingly actually really good for the price
customer_reviews.text: So this is an update from my older review. The company contacted me saying they were sorry and that they would send me a replacement free of charge, which I mean yeah I’ll take a free mouse whether it worked or not, it came in the mail a few weeks ago and it’s surprisingly actually really good for the price, feels good, works great the only gripe I have now is the software won’t let me download it, don’t know if that’s on my part or theirs, let alone doesn’t really matter, I never really remapped stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Chris_breezy9

customer_reviews.title: Should have went wireless!!!
customer_reviews.text: The good: The mouse functions well and is easily customized once you download the device driver. The bad: The braided cord comes with heavy kinks and catches on everything! I tried to avoid having to charge the mouse and I think that was a mistake. Not sure what I’m going to do. I’ll give it a little time and see if things smooth out. Sure makes it hard to game with a mouse that won’t go when your hand does...
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: I Didn't Expect This to Become My Everyday Mouse
customer_reviews.text: When I bought this mouse, I only intended to use it for gaming and keep my old mouse for general computer use. But then I started using this mouse and never wanted to use the old one again. The programmable buttons are helpful for many scenarios, such as gaming, navigating web pages, and using CAD software. It's easy to switch between programmed profiles to use the different button settings and mappings. The profiles can also be assigned different light signatures, which makes it easy to see at a glance which profile is currently in use. This mouse was a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Truitt

customer_reviews.title: Customer service is GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: I would like to give this 5 stars but unfortunately it seems to be faulting a bit now and it hasn't been long. At first i noticed the side buttons weren't very tactile and some didn't even have a click, they felt mushy but they worked at least. Recently I have been having issues with the sensor, I swipe straight horizontal line and it will taper down. If I move up it moves at an angle. 07/11/2018 UPDATE Edit: The company was kind enough to send me a replacement swiftly and promptly and the mouse has yet to break! Great Customer service, will update if the mouse breaks again.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Cruz Dominguez

customer_reviews.title: Solid alternative to mainstream brand names
customer_reviews.text: I'm coming from the original Razer Naga that I've used for many years. Claw grip guy. Pros - Cheap alternative to brand name Razer - Weight can be customised - Comes with replacement feet - Textured feel is refreshing and strangely nice to hold, might feel slipper though Cons - Middle-click is much harder to click than Razer Naga - Scrollwheel clicks are not as pronounced - More for palm grip users than claw. - Software slightly cluttered but works This is a good mouse all on its own. But I personally prefer a narrow mouse that I can claw grip easier. I will either go back to Razer, or perhaps try a Reddragon
customer_reviews.author: Douglas

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: This mouse is a good choice for someone who is looking for decent quality, while not having to spend an absurd amount of money. The number buttons on the side vary greatly in “feeling”. Some of the buttons feel rather mushy and you can’t really tell if you pressed it or not. In addition, the packaging was rather unprofessional and the software was kind of sketchy. It does however have excellent tracking, a decent feel, and a nice aesthetic.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, easy setup
customer_reviews.text: This is my first gaming mouse along these lines. I didn't want to drop a lot of money on this style without knowing for sure if I would like it or be able to use it. The mouse came in nice packaging. I like the texture, it's a rough so it grips nicely. The mouse immediately came up after I plugged it in. The drivers came on a small usb device and installed with no issues. The software is simple to use. Overall I'm very pleased with my purchase and would buy another if something happened to this one.
customer_reviews.author: scotrik

customer_reviews.title: Excellent mouse for half the price of name brand competitors
customer_reviews.text: My husband is very picky about his gaming mouse. The right clicker of his mouse was going out. He insisted that I buy some horribly overpriced popular brand of gaming mouse. After looking around and comparing reviews, I decided on this one. He is extremely happy with this mouse, and was shocked when I told him how inexpensive it was. Excellent mouse, easy to install, easy to program hotkeys, and the lights are cool.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley L.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't have my hopes too high for a gaming mouse at this price. I came from a Corsair M65 RGB. Loved that mouse but wanted more buttons. I didnt want to splurge for the new Corsair that was out at the time. After setting up my DPI on this mouse, it felt just as good as a higher tier mouse. The grip was great. The buttons did take some getting used to. I mainly use the first 6 buttons closest to my thumb. Click reaction is great too. I would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Arce

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement for my Naga
customer_reviews.text: I am thoroughly impressed by the value for this gaming mouse. I've used the same Naga for over five years until it started to fail on me recently. This mouse took me a couple of days to get used to, but I love it now! I like how the 12 button keypad has two distinct valleys that help the user with correct button use. It seemed weird at first, but it's a great design. Overall, it seems very high quality and and excellent value. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: After owning 2 Razer Naga mice, I gave this ...
customer_reviews.text: After owning 2 Razer Naga mice, I gave this one a shot. It works just as well and I paid about half when I bought it. The 12-key pad on the side has buttons that are arranged with slight sloping angles (1 2 3 >< 4 5 6) and (7 8 9 >< 10 11 12) which allows you to know which row you're feeling with your thumb. On the 2 Razer Nagas that I owned, they were all flat, so I would sometimes get rows confused. If you want a solid gaming mouse, especially for MMOs, give this one a try.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: OMG!! This mouse is great
customer_reviews.text: I have never used a mouse designed to this level. The mouse feels good and responds on the dime. I am coming from using a trackball mouse for the last few years. I can see myself using this mouse not only for gaming but for day to day use. I was expecting something small when i open the box and was surprise at the side of it and it fits my entire hand. I also love the LED lights and the fact you can adjust them. You can turn up the DPI right from the mouse which is another plus. If your considering this , this is a must buy.
customer_reviews.author: Mas

customer_reviews.title: Plug and Play
customer_reviews.text: Easy mouse to use for gaming. This mouse was a plug an play product that require no set up to start using. It has a nice coat on it that helps the hand grip as well as raised buttons on the side so that you can easily get used to the number convention that it uses. It offers several different speeds and lighting options. A week into using it and so glad that I made the change. Great price, Great feel, Great Response!
customer_reviews.author: M. L. Cheves

customer_reviews.title: It's okay but there's much better for about the same price
customer_reviews.text: 16400 DPI makes no sense at all.. you'll need to spend some time finding a setting that works for you. The macro creation is very limited, the software that comes with this mouse is poor at best. Other then that it looks good, feels good in my hand but the side buttons are a bit clunky and missed often. at least on the mouse that I bought. Overall not bad for the price but far inferior to G600 which is only a few dollars more..
customer_reviews.author: Asherz

customer_reviews.title: Update: Previous Died in a month but was replaced
customer_reviews.text: The mouse no longer functions but lights up. The software also no longer has a functioning website as the "drivers" I was sent doesn't work. I tried every port and 3 different PC's. This mouse is less than a month old and is now dead, Avoid this mouse! The price was good but you get what you pay for. Update: I was sent a replacement since it had an 18 month plan with it. SO far it has lasted 2 days
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Anderson

customer_reviews.title: An amazing mouse value but the software is completely broken
customer_reviews.text: This mouse is so ergonomic I'd almost give up my Logitech for it. Almost all of the MMO buttons are useful. It's a good weight it's good quality. unfortunately the current version of software on their website simply doesn't work with the mouse. You can't program it you can't change the settings you can't do anything with it. Apparently this has been a problem for more than 4 months. Buyer beware
customer_reviews.author: 04CE

customer_reviews.title: Thank you for such a Great Product. Easy Setup/Easy to learn/Greater gaming experience
customer_reviews.text: I just can't Get O...Ver this Mouse!!! YAY FOR ME!!! Thank you for such a Great Product. Easy Setup/Easy to learn/Greater gaming experience. I received this mouse today & I couldn't be Happier. Ne...ver going back to the same old same old. I'm a World of Warcraft Gamer & this has made a Great Difference (for the Good) in my gaming. Love that I can program all the macros & have different profiles for different games etc. Feels Great in my hand. I will Definitely share this experience with friends & family alike. Love the lights & the fact that I can change them & the weights also. You're (((Awesome))), UtechSmart!!! Love My Mouse!!! It's the Cadillac of Mice...<3
customer_reviews.author: Elkins

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse for gaming and work
customer_reviews.text: I've had this mouse for over 5 years now at this point (purchased August '14) and the mouse has help up extraordinarily well. In the last month I had my right mouse button sporadically do a double right click. The software was a little confusing at first, but if you're even a little techy, it should come pretty quickly. The RGB lighting still works perfectly, and the customization to it is nearly endless. Being able to set macros for each of the keys is super handy too. Overall, no complaints and im actually purchasing this mouse again since ive gotten so much use and enjoyed it so much.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Overall nice mouse
customer_reviews.text: This mouse is perfect for gaming, has removable weights as well as configurable buttons on the side. You can increase scroll speed with the arrows on the top of the mouse. The only downfall is that the click buttons start really far back. For example you can click with your knuckles instead of the point of your finger. This is causing issues in the game i am currently playing however i am trying to get used to it.
customer_reviews.author: fzr 600

customer_reviews.title: It is a mouse
customer_reviews.text: I got out. Tried it out once program security checked it. So far it looking intresting. I love the shape. it fits my long fingers. The weird thing there no weights. Go to the box. There no weight. I can look over that. The mouse has a nice feel to it. I will get back in a month. As I got a really nice replacement from another order. That mouse is also nice. Great way now to compare and contrastratst them.
customer_reviews.author: ronnie cutshall

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Just received this mouse today but I already love it. I recently started playing WoW and having to constantly move across the keyboard was a pain. After playing an hour on WoW with this mouse, it's like night and day. Setup is easy and convenient. I even left the settings window open to tweak anything in game as I came across it. For this price, I don't know if there's a better mmo mouse on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for your buck!
customer_reviews.text: I've come from a long history of using Razer mice and recently started running into a lot of issues with USB errors and mice not being recognized with my Razer stuff. Razer is top notch so im not sure where these issues came from but it prompted me to try out something new (and cheap(er)) because my Naga mice are relatively new and I didnt feel like dropping the coin on another one so soon. Figured I'd try this out since it was cost effective and I'm surprisingly astonished at its build and function. Definitely exceeded my expectations for the money and might even try out some other products now.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Goutermont

customer_reviews.title: Great for the Price
customer_reviews.text: This mouse is wonderful, and is exactly what I want out of a gaming mouse. The left and right click, the cord, adjustable weights and scroll wheel are awesome. I am disappointing that the side buttons are not unique, but maybe that's standard with gaming mouses. Also the sensitivity is not very adjustable for low-end, which isn't too big of an issue but isn't great. The lighting is simple and not really needed in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter Bolte

customer_reviews.title: Solid thumbgrid mouse
customer_reviews.text: This mouse was supposed to be a budget replacement for a failing Razer Naga Chroma, and boy does it fill that role. The included weight set went in and never came out since I like the extra bit of mass it adds. The thumbgrid buttons are not as tactile as the Naga's, but with use this becomes much less of an issue, especially considering there's no need for the Razer software. The software for this mouse is quite capable of doing what you need it to, and the DPI adjustment buttons below the scrollwheel are great now that I've learned to use them.
customer_reviews.author: Cory Couch

customer_reviews.title: I'm unsure if all of them are like this. Also sometimes the mouse will have an ...
customer_reviews.text: The middle mouse wheel is very loose. It moves from left to right constantly which makes it drag and hard to click unless i move it back to the side. Very hard to game with this minor flaw. I'm unsure if all of them are like this. Also sometimes the mouse will have an issue where it will only move vertically on the screen. I have reinstalled the driver multipal times. I had a UTech Smart mouse before this and never had problems. Got this mouse because of the macros which are amazing. I'm unsure if their is supposed to be a light on the bottom for the mouse to more accurate.
customer_reviews.author: SLYSANITY

customer_reviews.title: Crazy Extraordinary Mouse!
customer_reviews.text: So buying a mouse these days is so easy. Pick one up at the local drug store or Big Lots for less than 8 bucks. Then there is THIS mouse. This mouse was designed for gamers. My son just happens to be one of those. I bought him this mouse to help with his carpel tunnel syndrome and to give him a cool mouse to use to play his online games. Needless to say... I am the COOL MOM. :)
customer_reviews.author: MP

customer_reviews.title: Great Gaming Mouse
customer_reviews.text: I used nothing but the Logitech brand in the past and was looking for something new when my last gaming mouse failed on me. I like the UtechSmart Venus a lot. It's more comfortable, thanks to the clever thumb rest placement and the 12 side buttons are placed with such familiarity and convenience for a mmo-mouse vet so I was able to use them effectively almost immediately. The weight tuning option is a nice addition - though opening the weight cover took a bit of work. Overall, I am very happy with this mouse and I hope that it will last for a while with my heavy gaming usage.
customer_reviews.author: Love Summer

customer_reviews.title: Super sensitive mouse
customer_reviews.text: My husband's old mouse was wearing out, so it was time to get a new one. He typically doesn't bother too terribly much with gimmicks; he just wants to be able to adjust DPI and weight. DPI is stupidly high out of the box - higher than he even likes and normally he's complaining about mice being too slow. The color settings and programmable buttons are neat. The only thing he didn't care for was the textured surface - it just just a little strange and rough feeling but that could just from not being used to it.
customer_reviews.author: Eth

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and use. I didn't have to go looking anywhere for the drivers, it comes on a disc and took 5 seconds to install. The UI is super super easy to set up your keybinds and the color you want to glow, etc. Took me a little bit to get use to how it felt but I can't imagine not using it now. Definitely worth it for the price and I'm really glad that I bought this one!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Schmitz

customer_reviews.title: only 2 months
customer_reviews.text: Bought this mouse in Feb. 18 and I'm writing this April 13. So, it has nearly been 2 full months and the mouse is already messing up. It's freezing and when I'm playing an FPS or MMOs, it does this annoying thing where it looks straight up into the sky. Anyways, I'll keep searching for another mouse. So, Razer mouse suck and now UtechSmart mouse suck. My journey continues.
customer_reviews.author: Jose A.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice mouse for the price
customer_reviews.text: I've used this mouse for a few weeks now and it is a great bang for the buck mouse. You get increased functionality and a solid advantage over traditional mouse for gaming or daily use. I've played around with the software and all of it is very straightforward. I would highly recommend this mouse to anyone. I will say it does take some time to get used to so do give it a chance and you will really see the great value and investment in your purchase. Thank you Utech for this offering for more budget friendly mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Hung

customer_reviews.title: Feels great works great
customer_reviews.text: Product fits into large hand nicely. Button layout is comfortable, though the 8 button is a little soft. The weight adjustment is novel, and maybe some people like to adjust it. I thought it felt good in its heaviest form. The texture is nice. The clicks are crisp. The glide is smooth. The wheel roll has tactile notches you can feel as you turn it, like the hashes on the perimeter of a clock. The software is ok. It was easy enough to program and control my mouse configurations.
customer_reviews.author: Lettusaurus

customer_reviews.title: Not too confusing for a 12 button mouse
customer_reviews.text: My old gaming mouse broke. I was looking for a new one but was worried about a mouse that had 12 buttons on the side, and was looking for one with 6. Due the angles of the buttons on this mouse, it essentially feels like you have 2 sets of 6 buttons and they are a lot easier to navigate without clicking the wrong button. The mouse also feels good in my hand and works smoothly. 5/5
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I love this so far! The Color that it had is red ad it was the color i was going to place on it anyway! I placed the usb that it comes with, but i was not able to install the program to set up the mouse. That was not really an issue because it instantly works with the game i bought it for. I will keep trying to see if i can get that program it came with to work. Ill contact support if it still wont work for me. overall great product **5 Stars**
customer_reviews.author: Cecilia Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Great for a few months, then sensor started going crazy.
customer_reviews.text: I should have done my due diligence in looking at the negative reviews on this because just as many others mentioned, after a while, the sensor started freaking out. It's rather hit and miss. But in short, the mouse simply won't stay still, the cursor is jittery and all over the place once it starts to go. I thought, "Well maybe the lens is dirty." I took it apart entirely, cleaned it out, was clean as a whistle, put it back together, and it acted no different. I thought maybe an alternative to something like razer would be a good bet, but sadly, I'm back to using an old crappy logitech now.
customer_reviews.author: Derek M.

customer_reviews.title: Great functionality for the price
customer_reviews.text: The mouse functions great for the price, however, I have a few problems with where my pinky finger rests, though it's minor. The overall shape of the mouse is good, I'm ale to use it effectively with relatively small hands without issues. The side buttons are placed in a nice spot, but I wish i could bind them to more types of keys, and not just my numbers or letters. The material the mouse is made of is quite grippy, though it can get a little uncomfortable after long hours of play. Overall, it's a great mouse for the money, but it might not be great for someone with tiny little baby hands.
customer_reviews.author: Burfield

customer_reviews.title: It's a meh mouse.
customer_reviews.text: Definitely not a user-friendly devise. The directions that are included read like they've been through translation through five different languages. Go to their website and you find that they were offering some goodies for people to give them five star ratings. I bought this to get away from clicking skills on GW2, the button size and positioning results in me still clicking skills. I'm still trying to find a laser setting that is sensitive enough to move quickly with little motion and stable enough that you can actually double click without windows thinking you're wanting to drag something.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew S. Gonos

customer_reviews.title: Replaces Razer Naga Chroma
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this mouse to replace my aging/failing razor naga chroma. At almost 1/3 the price, I had to give it a shot. Pros: Has all the buttons I need for my MMOs Feels well made, fits comfortably in my large hand Plugged in and software installed easily (I saw a few reviews about impossible software, it was all very standard to me) Works great Cons The side buttons are a bit stiffer than I’m used to. Not faulting the company/product per say, just saying it’s a bit stiff
customer_reviews.author: brian west

customer_reviews.title: Had it for 4 years
customer_reviews.text: It worked great right up to the second half of the 4th year, where it started losing sensitivity and would stutter when moving. I bought another one, cause it was great for years. You can customize the buttons, you can customize the lights, you can customize the weight, you can customize sensitivity mid-game with presets. Great for FPSes when you need to switch between sniper and melee sensitivity. I use the number buttons instead of they keyboard so I don't have to sacrifice moving to reload or use other functionality.
customer_reviews.author: Dagwood

customer_reviews.title: Good mouse, horrible software
customer_reviews.text: Let me start by saying the mouse hardware is great. It’s comfortable enough and everything is in a good spot. That said from day one I have had on again off again trouble with the software. Recently I have to uninstall and reinstall it every other day. So basically the buttons aren’t usually what you think. It just isn’t worth the money or trouble.
customer_reviews.author: Dominick

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product with great customer service
customer_reviews.text: Ive had this mouse about 6 months now. I chose it originally because i came from a razer naga, and the quality of that mouse was horrible so i didn't feel i had anything to lose. I am honestly blown away, the quality of the mouse is fantastic. It feels sturdy, not cheaply made. The program i feel could use some work but overall it does everything i had hoped and then some. I had to contact customer support in regards to an issue i was having, and they were VERY responsive and went above and beyond to help me. I will definitely buy from them again.
customer_reviews.author: deershoot3r

customer_reviews.title: Cheap packaging, product didn't feel new
customer_reviews.text: I'm perfectly satisfied with the performance of this mouse. The buttons feel nice and I don't mind the slightly rough texture. I'm not a fan of the glossy accent or the lighting but that's just personal. My only complaint is that the box it came in was very cheap feeling and didn't feel new. It felt like it had been opened before and the mouse wasn't as clean as I would expect a 'new' mouse to be. I would have been satisfied if this was being sold as used, but this condition warrants the loss of a star in an otherwise positive experience.
customer_reviews.author: Woodrow Jang

customer_reviews.title: I am very happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with my purchase. This mouse is comfortable in my hand. The tracking is accurate. I don't play a lot of twitch FPS games. Mostly MMO and RTS. The mouse button clicks are precise and positive. Side buttons are better than the Corsair scimitar or G600 and as good as the Naga. The software is capable and intuitive. Honestly after i gave up on the scimitar I was mostly curious about the alternate brands of MMO mice. The Venus came up on a sale. I'm very happy I bought it. No regrets at all.
customer_reviews.author: M. A. Noland

customer_reviews.title: Nice Feel, lots of buttons, keypad hard for bigger hands to hit some buttons
customer_reviews.text: I love the feel of this mouse. It isn't slick and feels confident in the hand. Lots of room to make it flexible for any gaming need. Cable is long enough and i actually wrap some of it up so it isn't in the way. Ergonomically, i like it and my only wish was that some of the keypad numbers were pronounced in a way that gave the same confidence that the rest of the mouse has. I'd buy another one if I needed it. I have had several like this and this one is the best.
customer_reviews.author: Fair Haven Resident

customer_reviews.title: Decent Budget MMO Mouse
customer_reviews.text: For what this costs, I don't believe you will be disappointed. I replaced an older Razer Naga with this mouse, and I don't have any real complaints. The 1-12 buttons respond a little differently when pushed than my Naga, but I think they'll loosen up a little with use. Also, I have very large hands, so I kind of wish this was just a little bigger overall, but it's a good mouse for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Jon M.

customer_reviews.title: I don't use it for gaming, but love it for what I use it for...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great mouse. So much so, that this is the second one I bought. The programmable side buttons are awesome for storing multiple passwords or for any multiple keystroke tasks you do often. The programmable color selector is also pretty cool. All in all, it's a great mouse. Pretty easy to use and comfortable in the hand. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: David L. Flynn

customer_reviews.title: Very good but
customer_reviews.text: yes the quality is great, the buttons are excellent, everytime i click it it feels very premium BUT BUT BUT...your software makes my mouse lag on startup windows 10. for like 5-6 seconds during the boot my mouse doesn't move, it's not lag it's your software turning on. when i disable your software on boot i can freely move my mouse and when the software is on boot that 5-6 second lag is always annoying. should be fixable, but i doubt it will get fixed. anyways, good mouse.
customer_reviews.author: bentjug

customer_reviews.title: Solid gaming mouse
customer_reviews.text: I'm quite impressed. For the cost I was worried this would be junk, but it's solid construction. The side buttons have a wave texture to them, so you know where your fingers are. The software for controlling keybindings worked just fine. The only think I would have like is an option to disable profiles. It offers 5 but I really only have like 2 profiles I care to use. It just means I need to cycle past the 3 unused ones. Otherwise, this mouse exceeded expectations. Great price to value.
customer_reviews.author: RStock

customer_reviews.title: Bought this mouse almost 6 years ago and it is literally still working great!
customer_reviews.text: The best mouse you can buy for the money, period. 6 years and this thing is still kicking ass (Amazon says at the top that my last purchase was 2014) and so I bought another one to stash because I can't bear the thought of having to setup all my macros with other software where some features might not be present(ESPECIALLY FOR SUB $25!) I have page refresh, windows desktop switching macros, and the software is really thorough for my intents and purposes.. This is a winner for another 6 years for me.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Works good. I had to reboot to get the macros ...
customer_reviews.text: Works good. I had to reboot to get the macros to work, but then it worked fine. The buttons give me some ability to program in some often used key and mouse combinations. The two buttons on top allow me to change pointer speed quickly. I use "slow" for drawing intricate objects. I leave all the weights in that seems best for me. The light color and brightness are programmable also, i put mine on low and blue. I dont use this for gaming but i use it for everything else, like drawing, surfing, etc.
customer_reviews.author: MrAl

customer_reviews.title: BUY IT!
customer_reviews.text: 100% BUY IT! I use this mouse at work, I do data entry and have this puppy set up with all the keys I use most often. Because I have 1 button set to switch between the 5 available profiles and 2 buttons set to always be left and right mouse click the available 90 pre set buttons drops to 75, SEVENTY FIVE! You can program these to do whatever you want! Because it has onboard memory you don't have to worry about admin rights. Program it at home, take it wherever you want.
customer_reviews.author: Beaser Hendrix

customer_reviews.title: Excellent mouse that matches blows with others that are double the price
customer_reviews.text: I was really surprised with this mouse. It meets the performance of similar mice that cost at least twice as much. I had an issue after about a month with mine. The scroll wheel started randomly scrolling the opposite direction. After contacting the owners, they gave me several things to try and fix it. Gave me ideas for narrowing down the problem. In the end they gave me a replacement. Very easy to deal with. I am happy to stick with this mouse as well. it works GREAT for Fortnite building too.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Crabtree

customer_reviews.title: NOT MADE FOR MAC
customer_reviews.text: The packaging/website do not include software for MAC users. You'll have to do a ton of research to figure out a workaround. Also, I need the 1-12 buttons to acknowledge when the SHIFT key is held down so I can access '1' and '!' on the same button; this does not seem possible. EDIT: 1 to 3 Stars Quick response from customer service email. The mouse works as intended but cannot be programmed without access to a Windows computer.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Dane

product_meta.title: UtechSmart Venus Gaming Mouse RGB Wired, 16400 DPI High Precision Laser Programmable MMO Computer Gaming Mice [IGN's Recommendation]
feature_bullets: 『SENSITIVE DPI MMO MOUSE』Focus on MMO gamers: this professional MMO gaming mouse built-in up to 16400 DPI, 12000 FPS, 1000 Hz polling rate, 30G acceleration, 100-150in/s cursor speed, and a high precision Avago sensor. It has an adjustable sensitivity level (range from 200 - 16400) built right into the gaming mouse. You can easily adjust the mouse sensitivity using buttons on the mouse. Omron micro switches provide crisp, firm clicks.

『FULLY CUSTOMIZABLE MOUSE & RGB BACKLIT』Venus MMO wired gaming mouse with multiple programmable buttons (included 12 side buttons), 5 custom profiles each with 5 LED RGB colors backlit modes for quick identification of profiles and additional options for over 16 million LED RGB colors. The LED breathing light can be disabled according to your preference. Special Setting Switch Button on the bottom of the wired gaming mouse allows you to execute the switch profile command with maximum efficiency.

『PROGRAMMABLE MOUSE BUTTONS』All the macro buttons allow you to customize the functions to your specific needs and can be easily mapped to any of the usual keyboard keys, combos. Venus MMO gaming mouse with side buttons can be mapped to what will best fit your style of play are placed within easy reach of your thumb. “Auto Fire button" is a convenient key for most games that can optimize your preferences. It makes gaming so much easier and even has the ability to increase your level of gameplay.

『PRECISE CONTROL IN YOUR HAND』Venus MMO mouse is also an adjustable weighted mouse that comes pre-assembled with (2. 4g) x 8 weights inside. 12 buttons on the side are angled and can be positioned faster by touch alone. The Venus gaming mouse has a nice rest place on the left where your thumb can rest when not active. Comes with two durable smooth TEFLON feet pads for the bottom of the mouse to make the mouse slide better and bring the ultimate gaming experience for you.
